citation.article-title: Numerical taxonomy of rapidly growing, scotochromogenic Mycobacteria of the Mycobactrium parafortuitum complex: Mycobacterium austroafricanum sp. nov. and Mycobacterium diernhoferi sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Mycobacterium diernhoferi sp. nov.
Mycobacterium diernhoferi (diern hó fer i. of Diernhof, who originally isolated the organisms)
Acid-fast, rod-shaped cells 2 to 6 μm long and 0.5 μm wide.
Grows within 3 days.
Forms white, smooth colonies.
Non-photochromogenic.
Grows at 28 and 37°C, but does not grow at 42°C.
Resistant to NH2OH·HCl at a concentration of 125 μg/ml, but susceptible to NH2OH·HCl at a concentration of 250 μg/ml.
Resistant to isoniazid (10 μg/ml), 5% NaCl, thiophene-2-carboxylic acid hydrazide (1 μg/ml), rifampin (25 μg/ml), and p-nitrobenzoic acid (0.5 mg/ml); susceptible to ethambutol (5 μg/ml).
Tolerant of 0.2% picric acid and 0.1% NaNO2 in Sauton agar medium.
Tween 80 not hydrolyzed after 14 days.
Catalase (semiquantitative) negative, α-esterase negative, β-esterase positive, and β-galactosidase negative.
Nitrate reduced to nitrite after 6 h.
Acetamidase, urease, nicotiamidase, pyrazinamidase, and allantoinase positive, but negative for benzamidase, isonicotinamidase , salicylamidase , and succinamidase.
Niacin is not produced.

Glutamate, glucosamine, monoethanolamine, and trimethylene diamine are utilized as simultaneous nitrogen and carbon sources, but serine, acetamide, and benzamide are not utilized as such sources; acetate and pyruvate are utilized as sole sources of carbon in the presence of ammoniacal nitrogen, but citrate, succinate, malate, benzoate, malonate, and fumarate are not utilized as such sources.

Glucose, fructose, mannose, arabinose, xylose, inositol, and mannitol are utilized as sole sources of carbon, but sucrose, galactose, rhamnose, trehalose, and sorbitol are not utilized as such sources.
Ethanol, n-propanol, n-butanol, and isobutanol are utilized as sole sources of carbon, but propylene glycol, and 1,3-, 1,4- 2,3-butylene glycols are not utilized as such sources.
Source: soil in a cattle field.
Type strain: 41001 (= ATCC 19340).
